summary: Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen), a rather clueless police detective, tries to foil a plot to turn innocent people into assassins through mind control. After his partner, Norberg (O.J. Simpson), is shot, Frank sets out to find the culprit, leading him to business tycoon Vincent Ludwig (Ricardo Montalban). However, Frank has no evidence until he meets Jane Spencer (Priscilla Presley), Ludwig's assistant. She knows nothing about Ludwig's devious plans, but falls for Frank and agrees to help him.

reviews.content: not enough nudity for a movie called naked
The funniest nonsense terrorist movie ever before Zohan, perfect when you only have 80m to kill. WTH Wahahahahaha....lol
Hysterical. One of my favorites.
Cheap laughs. Dry humor and a lot of fun

Basking in slapstick humor and goofiness with an on-point lead performance from Leslie Nielsen, the first Naked Gun film understands mostly what it is, despite some of its farce and disorienting substance.
Good clean love, without utensils

Despite having more than its fair share of extremely low-brow humor, The Naked Gun is, more often than not, laugh out loud funny.  The perpetually incompetent Lt. Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen) stumbles across a devious plot to assassinate Queen Elizabeth and, with the assistance of his only slightly more competent partner Ed Hocken (George Kennedy), embarks on an outlandish journey to save the day.  While a ton of jokes miss the mark, the vast majority are comedy gold, including some extended set pieces that have to be seen to be believed.  While the cast, which includes the likes of Ricardo Montalban, Priscella Presley, and O.J. Simspon, among others, is great and do a solid job, the movie is stolen by Nielsen, whose deadpan delivery never fails to come through.
Best of Movies/TV Series Collection

An All Time Classic Comedy and one The Best Films as well! While both this & Airplane! are 5 Star Classics I personally prefer The Naked Gun because you get More Leslie Neilson. The Deadpan straight faced acting Excellent in this and each actor really has comedic chemistry as well. The jokes are still outstanding in this and are very well set up, intelligent, and made my cheeks hurt by the end I was laughing so much. Fantastic Editing, Pacing, and very effective cinematography that keeps the focus on the jokes at hand. An All Time Classic!

Basking in slapstick humor and goofiness with an on-point lead performance from Leslie Nielsen, the first Naked Gun film understands mostly what it is, despite some of its farce and disorienting substance.
This movie remains a masterpiece, even after 30 years, and no film has since been more funnier. Great plot, great jokes, great cast, especially Leslie Nielsen who plays the best part of his career.
This movie is so amazing and very funny.
Top-tier humor. They genuinely don't make them like this or airplane. The dry humor is exactly what I look for in movies. Leslie Nielson's character never fails to get a laugh out of me.

I couldn't find a place to review the Seattle Mariners latest baseball commercial so I'll write it here. Holy cow that Seattle Mariners baseball commercial was creepy in the most wholesome way possible. I can't help but be suspicious of any baseball fan. WTF man. You can't pretend to be that innocent without becoming suspect. You might as well have had Eddie Haskell in it. I don't trust you, ever.

Ok, so I just watched this movie after watching the six episodes of Police Squad! (Did I somehow make it through youth in the 80s in the US without watching either, at the time? I think I basically did, though I'm sure they were on in the background at some point.) Tbh the series was snappier. The hammy nature of several of the bits was more hammy, because of episode-to-episode repetition. Norberg and Hocken have funnier stuff to do in the series and better dynamics with Drebin. The love interest in the movie has some funny moments but also a lot of dull ones. I'm sad that the shoeshine guy didn't make an appearance; I always looked forward to his part in Police Squad! All in all, the movie has a lot of really funny moments, but it also drags, and I kept wondering when / if it was going to pick up.

I watched this as part of watching a series of cop shows; I was interested to try to understand more about this genre which has been so expansive in American cinema since the 70s, to try to figure out why it has been so compelling, in various forms, and whether it tells us anything about this moment of competing demands: to defund the police, to recall left-liberal prosecutors, to puncture the mystique of the police in the aftermath of an abject, sickening failure like in Uvalde. However, I am too lazy to deconstruct anything, so I mostly just watch the movies and shoot fish in a barrel. (I love shooting fish in a barrel! Sometimes, I get one! And it always makes me happy. However, it's kind of messy. I've been thinking about trying a net.)

Police Squad! and Naked Gun are interesting in this regard in that they sort of survey the tropes that had become standard over the 70s and early 80s in cop shows, boil them down, and exaggerate them for yuks. Honestly, I would have to think more about where some of these come from. The early 70s renegade cop movies I've been watching are great for understanding the bleeding edge of the ideology and the desire, but they don't offer the most boiled down version of the tropes that later became standard.

One low-key aspect of this first Naked Gun movie that I liked: when Drebin plays, for what seems like it's aiming at stupid fun, something that turns out not to be funny at all -- in fact, he killed five actors who were putting on a Shakespeare in a Park festival (and not just any actors, but good ones!), or he finds exculpatory evidence for a guy who was already sent to the electric chair, or he laments, upon the possibility of losing his badge, that the next time he shoots someone, he could be arrested. You could easily overlook these short, deflating moments, but they tell the truth about policing in a way that a lot of cop shows don't. All of this bumbling isn't *just* for yuks. Ok, it's 98% for yuks, but it's also maybe 2% serious about quietly planting the idea that all this bumbling might not be just fuzzy and endearing. Of course, the cops still get the bad guys, every time, and the Dirty Harry fanboys probably just kept laughing.

Leslie Nielson's death last November was a big shock to me. Sure he has been in some bad films, such as 2001:A Space Travesty, but he had also made some quintessential classics such as Airplane, the only film of his career I consider better than this, and the Naked Gun series, of which this is the best. Whatever the outcome of the film, that doesn't stop me from considering Nielson a comedy genius.

The Naked Gun:From the Files of Police Squad! is fast, furious, zany and most importantly, enormous fun film. While it looks great, is wonderfully directed, brilliantly paced with seldom a dull moment and has energetic music and a fun story, it is the humour and acting that really makes this film so good.

The dialogue is deliciously dry-witted, and the plentiful juvenile gags never cease to be hilarious. Nielson gives one of his career's best performances in a wonderfully deadpan characterisation as an likable inept character. The support performances from Priscilla Presley, George Kennedy and OJ Simpson are equally great, but special mention has to go to Riccardo Montalban who just oozes cool.

Overall, a hilarious film. Forget rubbish like Disaster Movie, 2001:A Space Travesty, Meet the Spartans and Epic Movie and watch the classic spoof movies like Young Frankenstein, Airplane, Galaxy Quest and this. You won't regret it! 10/10 Bethany Cox
Sonic King and king lord lord king

A spoof of, among other things, '70s cop shows is full of rapid-fire sight gags, slapstick and deadpan ridiculous dialogue.  Some elements are gratingly lowbrow or overdone; but for the most part it works, particularly the raucous energy of the major setpieces.
I had a lot of good laughs and generally a good time watching The Naked Gun.
I couldn't stop laughing through out the whole movie pure comedy...
This movie is a fucking riot. It's one of Leslie Nielsen's best performance yet. Full of laughs, and full of action. 5/5
Naked Gun is an unapologetically low-brow comedy in which most of the jokes land. Some of the references are dated, but most of the movie holds up.
It's wonderful and funny. Leslie Nielsen is a comedy genius. You must watch if you love the comedy genre. 8/10
I hate slapstick and one trick ponies and thats why I did not like this movie, sure it passed the time, I guess its just me!!!

Ridiculous gags and nonstop jokes.

David Zucker's absurdist crime comedy The Naked Gun (1988) is very funny with outrageous gags and creative visual direction that keeps you on your toes. If you look away from the screen for even a moment, you'll miss like 3 different jokes going on in the background. It's not as hilarious as Airplane! or Top Secret!, but The Naked Gun is still a classic comedy with plenty of laughs.

Leslie Nielsen can deliver any goofy or joke line in a perfectly serious deadpan voice and it is funny every time. He's so calm given all the strange and hilarious situations that I'm always entertained by Nielsen's shenanigans. Priscilla Presley is surprisingly funny and keeps up with Nielsen's absurd energy. You never buy their romance or like the endless string of sex jokes there for a quick crude laugh, but their comedic chemistry is more important. The Naked Gun has it all, even Top Secret! superfan Weird Al Yankovic!

Ricardo Montalban is excellent as the villain. His casual manner tells you everything you need to know with a more nuanced performance than some of the more colorful characters in The Naked Gun. George Kennedy plays a gung ho cop who just allows Nielsen to do whatever he wants with reckless abandon and it's great. I love how The Naked Gun cast O.J. Simpson just to beat the hell out of him.

Writers Jerry Zucker, Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, and Pat Proft make efficient use of their 86 minutes to tell a silly story with as much visual flair and comedic insanity imaginable. I will not spoil anything in The Naked Gun, so that all the jokes are fresh, but I will say that the breakin and baseball gags are glorious.

In short, The Naked Gun will always be a comedy worth revisiting for a series of rapid fire laughs.
A goofy movie that I enjoyed the whole way through...absolutely hilarious! A classic.
A hysterical laugh-riot of hijinks, pratfalls, and wordplay follow a thin plot that doesn't really matter much. Fans of Airplane! and Space Balls will enjoy this irreverent flick.
hilarious!!! Definitely should watch!
Leslie Nielsen at his best, timeless classic.
This film is so hilarious, I refuse to spoil it for you here. Go watch it, you wont regret it.

This cop comedy was pretty good. Leslie Neilsen, Priscilla Presley, George Kennedy, and the rest of the cast did a great job in this movie. The plot of the movie was entertaining and humorous. It's probably one of Lesli Nielsen's best movies ever. If you haven't seen this movie yet, check it out sometime. You'll enjoy it.
The greatest adaption of the TV series!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This movie was okay! It's definitely not super silly, unlike Airplane! The movie has a good cast, but the story was kind of dull! I still don't think crime and comedy don't  gel together, which is probably why I didn't like this film!  I like Leslie Nielsen, as the star, but nothing really matched up! It was fun for the first half, it gets boring later on! I wish this movie was more fun, so I could enjoy it more!
Only saw clips in the past online, but finally saw the whole movie. Decently funny.
A spoof classic that I found funny, not hilarious. The jokes usually land, other times they're more silly and goofy than actually funny. Leslie Nielsen (R.I.P.) was born for these roles.
Leslie Nielsen is awesome and there's lots of laughs throughout.
Leslie Nielsen stars in his most famous role as Frank Drebin.  It has plenty of laughs, but is still just a silly comedy.  You definitely don't want to take this one serious.
Naked Gun, along with Airplane! and Spaceballs, is one of the most well known spoof films, deftly utilizing the puns, callbacks, and middle school humor to achieve some genuine laughs. 7.5/10
Trailblazer for movies of this type.

Let's be clear from the outset. This isn't Shakespeare. Neither is it intended to be. Some puns that will leave you groaning yet laughing simultaneously. Things going on in the background as the cast deliver zingers at front of screen. You wonder how many times Leslie Neilsen (Frank Drebin) broke up laughing in takes at some of the golden comedy he was working with yet he deadpans his way through some of the most delightfully silly laughs you will ever have. Putting aside his "other side" OJ Simpson plays the straighter man of Nordberg perfectly while George Kennedy takes the Captain Ed role into whichever corner Drebin leads him next.

Priscilla Presley shows surprising comedic timing as Jane Spencer as she switches effortlessly from straight woman to second banana throughout - any scene with Neilsen is a delight. Watch out for Weird Al Yankovic's cameo (he has one in all 3 movies in the franchise) but don't let your attention wander too far otherwise you may miss another sight gag or quick zinger. Just a complete hoot from start to finish.

Jeff Barnes 
9/22/20 


The Naked Gun Review
	The Naked Gun has plenty of comedy. The protagonist Frank Drebin ends up getting himself in the most hilarious situations. It has toilet humor, sexual humor, and a fair amount of dirty jokes in it and it's all done brilliantly.
	In The Naked Gun an incompetent policeman named Frank Drebin sets out to prevent an assassination attempt on Queen Elizabeth the Second.
	The funny thing about Frank is that he's not only incompetent but also flawed in many other ways. He has difficulty reading between the lines such as when he steps off a plane and assumes since he's one the first people off the plane that the microphones, and crowd cheering is all set up for him but it's really set up for Weird Al Yankovic since he was on the same plane. He also lives in a very poor manner. In his apartment he has lots of old outdated food in his frig.  
	There's one toilet joke in The Naked Gun which involves Frank using a toilet, which is funny in itself because it's literally a toilet joke. It's a quirk in which Frank forgets to take off a radio mic during a press conference before he goes to the bathroom and this results in everyone at the press conference hearing him go to the bathroom.
	The Naked Gun also has sexual quirks which is appropriate considering sexual quirks are generally associated with toilet humor. There's a hilarious quirk which involves Frank using a dildo and getting in trouble for it. There's also a funny moment in which Frank and Jane, his partner, decide to overly use protection for them having sex.  
	Frank ends up getting himself in lots of funny situations. He goes to a baseball game because he finds out that that's where the assignation attempt on Queen Elizabeth the Second is supposed to take place. The fact that Queen Elizabeth II is at a baseball game is funny because it's the last  kind of place that you would expect her to be because she's with a bunch of people who are the exact opposite of what she is because they're:  uncivilized, unsophisticated, and not very royal. One of the funny situations involves Frank going undercover as an umpire and he doesn't even know exactly what to do as an umpire at first. He goes undercover as an opera singer and gets in trouble for it. 
	The Naked Gun has off the wall funniness and it also has many situations that Frank and other characters get themselves in and the comedy in it is brilliant.

5 bagger for this classic, it was a welcome treat on the road to 531, we'd gotten lost on that road. Not enough comedy. But when you got movies like Leslie Nielsen in them, you can't lose! It's always good to see OJ in a movie. He was a good fit for the role, unlike his glove.
Some very funny scenes but also some very stupid ones as well.
Aiming to be silly and satirical, it succeeds in both aspects regarding the police genre thanks to leslie Nielsen's comedic timing. 4.25

If you liked Airplane!, you'll probably like Naked Gun. Leslie Nielsen exchanges his stethoscope for a badge and a gun as Det. Frank Drebin in a film full of slapstick, one-liners, and double-entendres.
Unless you love slapstick it isn't great.

Sometimes you just need a big dose of dumb humor, and The Naked Gun fits that description perfectly. Leslie Nielsen is fantastically clueless in his role of Lieutenant Frank Drebin. The laughs are plentiful and varied, giving you wordplay one minute and slapstick the next. Sometimes the Zucker brothers push the limits of ridiculousness a little too far, but I think they found the right balance with this hilariously stupid comedy.

With great relief it is not an intellectual property-based parody but rather an original as a more apparent successful key, following "Airplane!" is pure definition of comedy gold despite its occasional juvenile nature and sappily capped off climax. (B+)
With a joke every 5 seconds, The Naked Gun is just plain amazing.

"The Naked Gun" is one of those silly movies that just embraces its goofiness and works. There are so many little things in this movie that are hilarious. It reminded me a lot of "Airplane!" and made me wish that the spoof genre was still this good. If you're looking to laugh a lot, this is a very solid choice. A movie that is pretty much entirely jokes is bound to have a few that don't hit as hard, but a good portion of this movie had me laughing uncontrollably. Overall, this is a very funny classic comedy that fans of the golden era of spoof movies will love.
Classic. Somehow still funny.

The Naked Gun is the first movie where I lost my actual shit with laughter. My dad let me stay up late and by the time he goes to the toilet with his microphone on, I was absolutely hooked. No movie has ever delivered such phenomenal hilarity from start to finish, and Leslie Nielsen's performance only gets better with every viewing. Even OJ is forgiveable, that's how good this is. In fact the saddest part about the Bronco chase in 94 was that I knew there could never be a fourth Naked Gun, and that will always haunt me. When my first son is born in 3 months, I will show him this movie the day he is born. That's how good this movie is. Unparalleled.
This cop comedy is one of the best. Shows why Leslie Nielsen was so great at doing comedy. You will laugh until your sides hurt. If you love Airplane, then you will love this movie. A true classic.
Leslie Nielsen shines in his role as an overconfident and suave lieutenant of the police force. A joy to watch and a movie to enjoy.

A goofy, stupidly funny movie that holds a place for everyone. This movie is meant for fast pace-nonchalant, careless "normal" comedy. Thanks to Leslie Nielsen, for a great performance. Leslie Nielsen gives off this oringal feel, like if he was meant for his role. In conclusion, this movie is cheesy, normal in a comedy way, and can at least make one person laugh. Solid 4/5. This movie may not exactly be for everyone, but this movie is exactly what it's supposed to be. A goofy comedy that holds a laugh for at least one person.
Ridiculous! But not always clever.
For a comedy is above so many
With inexcusably coarse humor and ridiculously serious performances to go along with it, The Naked Gun is a naughty masterpiece.
one of the best comedy movies ever made.

A solid goofy comedy film with great fourth wall breaks and instantly quotable dialogue. Leslie Nielsen is at his best when he's delivering not-so-serious lines with an incredibly serious tone and candor. The plot is completely forgettable and even a day after the film, I completely forgot what took place over the course of the film. But what's more important in a screwball movie is the performances and dialogue. And the film delivers quite well on those premises. However, I just don't find these premises strong enough to overcome a totally formulaic plot (even for a goofball comedy) and the somewhat mediocre performances by those not named Leslie Nielsen. Overall, this film is one diehard comedy fans should check out but those who favor structure and coherence should probably steer clear.
Watching OJ back then is really strange and weird...
A classic comedy movie that everybody should watch

What's not to like about this movie? The Naked Gun has the best comedy ever put into film since Airplane! The performance of Leslie Nielsen as Frank Drebin was solid gold. Ricardo Montalban's performance as the villain is also a perfect piece of the movie. Heck even Priscilla Presley, the former wife of Elvis, is good in that film. I like the script and the cameos like Weird Al Yankovic and Reggie Jackson. The only issue that I have with this movie is O.J. Simpson, even though it's just a minor issue due to outcome of his popularity. Overall, The Naked Gun provided my the evidence to solve this case in a high note.

A Haloriouse parody, that deserversto be praised for its cleaver gag's. Sadly there is not to much plot on the villians side of the story
Grade: A-

I think what's so great about the Naked Gun series, and the movies that Leslie does, is that your always anticipating something funny right around the corner. It could be something as minute in detail as a prop but there's always an anticipation to see what's popping up next. You can see where a lot of the inspiration for the Scary Movie series came from. 

That whole money exchange scene was so funny. Genius whoever thought of that. This is one of those comedy movies that's so funny and outlandish that I didn't even care about the plot of the movie. It's very clever and witty on such a goofy level but it's done in such a brilliant way.

One of the funniest movies I've seen.

Before the '90s gave rise to The Dude from "The Big Lebowski," and the 2000s gifted us "Borat", there was ludicrous "The Naked Gun" and the legendary Frank Drebin, played with the straightest straight-face ever by the remarkable Leslie Nielsen. "The Naked Gun" comes from the ancestory.com chart originating with "Blazing Saddles," most readily identified by the mighty "Airplane!," and most recently carried forth by raunchy music industry satire "Stadium Anthems."

Gags in "The Naked Gun" rain down like biblical flood; some are deceptively high-brown, but most gloriously inane. It takes absolute geniuses to create such elevated stupidity.

Is "The Naked Gun" somehow even better than its "Airplane!" forefather? By a nose, the vote here is "yes." While "Airplane!" also features Nielsen as a doctor (arguably even more straight-faced than Frank Drebin), that film's central character was the adequate Robert Hays, whereas "The Naked Gun" gives us Nielsen as the prime purveyor of every last morsel of hilarity. This is simply one of the greatest and most influential comedies in the history of film. - WATCHED IT? THEN WATCHLIST:
"Top Secret!"
"Stadium Anthems"
"Hot Shots!"

Spun off from a short-lived TV show that only lasted six episodes, The Naked Gun's hilarious gags that still hold up and Leslie Nielsen's performance and line delivery make this ZAZ offering possibly one of the best comedies of all time.
This is an excellent comedy movie with many moments that have me laughing for minutes. I'd recommend this movie to anyone with a good sense of humor. A great film.
The only comedy. Last 15 years the was no comedies at all.
A fun and silly pick me up!
Just such a great classic comedy
The best comedy movie ever made!
I haven't laughed this hard at a movie since Deadpool 2. It's just the perfect level of Columbo adult comedy.
One of the funniest movies I've ever seen (right up there with Airplane and Monty Python & the Holy Grail)

an attention seeker..

Naked Gun

Naked Gun is a plot driven comic crime about a cop whose clumsy actions turns everything whimsical after he touches it. It weaves out an intense sequence with such sincerity that you fall for it and then it mocks it away on all levels where you find yourself practically all giddy up for more. 

But amidst all these tomfoolery it fiddles subconsciously with the viewers and somehow manages to reach a definite point that is put up front with crystal clear voice. With a zazzy yet incongruent background score, annoyingly loud sound effects, daft cinematography and amateur editing, it falls flatly on face on technical aspects. All the husbandry gags are just cherry on top that makes you root for it more and more as it ages on screen. 

Ticking for around 90 minutes, the tightly packed screenplay never lets you wander off its sketchy world, it may be illogical but it's hilarious, it may be redundant but it somehow is feasible and it may overdo sometime but it works like a charm. Neilson's comic timing is off the hook, he hits a home run on every throw and its his expressive or inexpressive face is what fuels this comic into a bit more than one anticipates for. Because at certain points even writers may fall short but he delivers every time and every line. 

His ludicrous attempts to not only convince others but himself too, is what makes him stand alone than any other actors in here, his strong belief in each and every gag is clearly visible through his mannerism and tone. Zuker's execution barely matters in here, it is good but armed with such an attention seeking script one rarely wonders about it. 

Naked Gun might be an attention seeker, but why not just give it to it, there won't be any regrets.

The Naked Gun is a great series of slapstick comedy that will make you yearn for simpler times. Leslie Nielson at the end of his career started doing slapstick humor after the tremendous success of Airplane. Naked Gun started as a television show- Police Squad which ran for 6 episodes. The visual and verbal gags are downright hilarious and clever and just looking at Neilson one can start burst laughing. The supporting cast is really good from (ahem) OJ Simpson to Priscilla Presley and all have been etched in our collective memories. If you want a good laugh you cannot go wrong with Naked Gun.

The Naked Gun is a great series of slapstick comedy that will make you yearn for simpler times. Leslie Nielson at the end of his career started doing slapstick humor after the tremendous success of Airplane. Naked Gun started as a television show- Police Squad which ran for 6 episodes. One of the funniest comedies I have ever seen.

Leslie Nielson is hilarious with his deadpan face and playing the clumsiest cop since Inspector Clouseau in a very funny parody of film noirs and James Bond movies that is a considerable step above Airplane! and Top Secret! in terms of more well-inspired jokes and gags.

It works on so many levels, you just can't resist its appeal, it's ultra-funny, it's a nicely done spoof on detective stories, even parodies noir style. And of course on top of all that is Leslie Nielsen. It really is funny, I haven't laughed so hard for a long time. The movie follows the tradition of the dead-pan humour of "Airport' and would later be used in such films as 'Hot Shots' and 'Scary Movie' but Leslie Nielsen is head and shoulders ahead of them all.
The Naked Gun is a masterpiece in parody. If you have a crass sense of humor, you'll enjoy this movie.
best comedy until Airplane!

Gut bustingly hilarious when it first came out, but now not quite as much. Leslie Nielsen is undeniably funny as police detective Frank Drebin, the incompetent but deadly serious hero of the film who must stop an assassination attempt on Queen Elizabeth, though the film's humor is really around the incidental moments occurring around the main story. Some of those moments still hold up and others do not. What was most surprising watching this film now is how leisurely paced it seemes compared to contemporary rapid fire comedies. It was also very odd to see O.J. Simpson playing kind mild mannered police detective Nordberg. Overall, this is still a worthy comedy and certainly worth checking out.
One of the best parody ever

A super fun movie about a dumb cop who goes after a villain who is trying to kill the Queen of England.  It is full of lots of slapstick that will have even the most stubborn people laughing. It is laugh out loud funny and easy to enjoy. I highly recommend it!!!

***
Silly and ridiculous, but all the better for it. Although 'The Naked Gun' may start to trail off towards the end, its compact running time and slapstick humour make it a highly enjoyable comedy.
How can a movie this dumb be so smart?
Big screen adaptation of the short-lived (but great) Police Squad! tv series and even recycles some of the jokes.  Funny throughout, loved the way they did the baseball game.

The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! is directed and co-written by David Zucker, and it stars Leslie Nielsen in a comedy about a lieutenant who's in a crime that he has to solve, but he's really not that bright, and he come across in a romance with an assistant. When it comes to the Zucker Brothers being together, they tend to make some comedies that are a classic. So with this, it's also a classic that is just as fantastic as Airplane!. Leslie Nielsen is really good at taking things seriously in a very comedic way that brings out a lot of laughs. It's interesting to see that it doesn't entirely make it obvious about who the villain is, and even if it did, that's probably because he was in a film that was one of the well known films of all times. I like how in a detective spoof like this, it still has the interesting detective stories that could be taken seriously as a action detective film, but also doesn't give out the whole case out in the beginning, just the basis of it. The writing by Jerry Zucker, Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, and Pat Proft give out a lot of jokes for us to handle, and they kept hitting the mark as I kept laughing so much in it. Frank Drebin is very likable and silly to watch that you can't help but find him enjoyable. The Naked Gun is a fantastic film that it's sad to see that this is the last film where the Zucker Brothers and Jim Abrahams were involved together.
I love all the naked gun movies.  Not sure why I love this slapstick comedy by I do.  Guilty pleasure
11/20/2016: An ok goofy movie with quite a few funny moments.

With HollyWood nowadays you come to see all of the same movies. Sure they have different plots and different casts. But it's really the same movie. You have your Horror movies and then dramas and then action movies. We as audiences wanted something completely different. Now I'm not saying that I hate these kinds of films but I wanted new ideas instead of reboots. Thus The Naked Gun was born. Well I can't really say that this movie was original because was based on a TV show. But this gave us something new for audiences to sink their teeth in. Thus with The Naked Gun, the spoof genre was born cranking out film like Scary Movie and Epic Movie. The Naked Gun combines some of the funniest humor that you can get from a film. It's like the filmmakers of this movie were like "If we're going to scoff all of these spy movies, then we have to do it right"! And the filmmakers clearly show it. This film not only combines the best speaking humor, but also the best visual humor. And this movie is jam-packed with all of this kin of humor. Like in one scene Frank (Leslie Nielsen) says "Nice Beaver". The girl Jane (Priscilla Presely) says "Thank you, I just had it stuffed" She then pulls down an actual stuffed Beaver from the attic. When you watch the movie and see the joke you'll get it. The Naked Gun is a funny comedy and I totally recommend it.

I've always been a fan of well-made spoofs and farcical comedies, and I've often held up the Naked Gun series as a shining example of how good this genre used to be.  Sure enough this movie gets me laughing more than anything manufactured by the Wayans' brothers.  I must admit, though, that the first 2 acts of the movie struggle at times to keep a consistent level of comedy.  There are moments where the jokes fall flat, and it sometimes struggles to recover quickly because they keep working through those ineffective jokes.  However, when the 3rd act hits, this is easily one of the funniest movies I know.  From the second they arrive at the baseball game I am just in tears with laughter, and it does not stop until the credits roll.  In fact, I actually had to remind myself there were some slower parts of the movie as soon as I was done watching, because I'm on such a high from that whole final sequence.  I'll also quickly address the one reservation some people bring up with these movies: "Isn't it weird/hard to watch these films with O.J. Simpson in them as a cop, considering what we all assume he did?"  It could be, however, since his character (Nordberg) is constantly getting the crap kicked out of him in these movies, it kind of works.  In fact one could even consider it somewhat cathartic to watch him get shot, punched, and dropped so frequently.  Overall, I think the first Naked Gun movie is by far the best, and despite some slower moments that struggle with humor, it ends with a big bang that is seldom matched by other spoof movies including its own sequels.

The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! is just simply hilarious. The jokes just keep coming, and all the jokes that I remember were hit, and not miss. Even if there was a moment a joke wasn't being delivered, Leslie Nielsen's presence is exciting enough. I don't remember many films that have such a blend of slapstick, witty dialogue, and all other sorts of debauchery packed into a brief 85 minute picture.
Although its a bit overrated, I still enjoyed it and had fun with its silly humor.

I guess I've never found Leslie Nielsen to be very funny. His standard character seems to be a direct ripoff of Peter Sellers' "oblivious to the world", moronic detective in Pink Panther, which I never found very funny. Too many silly sight gags and thoroughly predictable "geez, let's guess what the moron will do next" scenarios just bore the heck out of me. But I guess the general public loves that stuff.

Full Review: The Naked Gun showed its time the validity of the comedy genre if people truly put their minds to it. The movie is unforgettable for being chocked full of great gags that never compromise. Its plot is certainly silly, and the romance is cliched, but this is easily forgiven for it just serves as fuel for more laughs. The Naked Gun is hilarious and keeps viewers laughing, which is all you can ask of a comedy.

For example, it's hilarious to me when they're on stakeout eating red pistachios and they have that red powder all over their hands and lips. And the Enrico Palazzo stuff is legendary. Throw in a younger Livia Soprano as the Mayor uttering the classic line "Entering without a search warrant, destroying property, arson; sexual assault with a concrete dildo?"  Such a great movie.

"THE ADVENTURES OF FRANK DREBIN PART 1"

- One of the best comedy film franchise is in my opinion 'The Naked Gun' series. The first movie 'The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!' dates from 1988 and was directed by David Zucker. The storyline is about police lieutenant Frank Drebin, played by the brilliant Leslie Nielsen (Airplane, Spy Hard), who tries to stop an assassination attempt on Queen Elisabeth II who is visiting LA. I absolutely love the mix of different kinds of humor; slapstick, visual and verbal puns and of course the face of Leslie Nielsen! Starring Priscilla Presley (Dallas), George Kennedy (Airport films, Intensive Care), Ricardo Montalban (Spy Kids 2 and 3) and O.J. Simpson (The Towering Inferno). Entertainment guaranteed. Impossible not to laugh!

When officer Nordberg (Simpson) unsuccessfully attempts to bust a drug operation on a boat near the docks, lieutenant Frank Drebin (Nielsen) and captain Ed Hocken (Kennedy) promise him to catch the one who is responsible for Nordberg's injury. The few clues lead Frank to the wealthy Vincent Ludwig (Montalban), who he suspects is planning an assassination on the British queen Elisabeth II. In order to gain prove Frank interrogates Ludwig's assistant the beautiful Jane Spencer (Presley). Can Frank and his police squad catch the bad guys?

There were so many crass attempts at wringing laughs from each scene that every now and again, I was caught off guard and had to smirk, eventually succumbing to the charms of it's goofy and unashamedly tasteless humour.

Leslie Nielsen brings his best deadpan delivery of otherwise absurd lines to this movie. This comedy plays off of intelligently written gags and off-the-cuff misinterpretations that work so well so much of the time. As an added bonus, viewers get to see O.J. Simpson (pre-murder trial) in physical pain.

I have seen funnier movies but this one is still hilarious and it holds up nicely with time.  Nielsen is PERFECT for this role.  There were some scenes where I was laughing hard!!  If you haven't seen this movie, where have you been hiding?!  I can watch this over and over again...

I think these ZAZ (Zucker, Abrahams, Zucker) spoof films work so well because they really don't let up on the jokes. From beginning to end, it's just a hilarious combination of slap stick, visual gags and word play. Some of the jokes will take you by surprise, and others telegraph their arrival - but I would say the vast majority hit their mark in The Naked Gun.

The film's success is partly due to Leslie Nielsen's great dead-pan performance as Lt. Frank Drebin, but mostly its about the writing. The ZAZ team (plus Pat Proft) do a great job lampooning the detective crime drama genre, and turn every stereotypical plot device on its proverbial head with hilarious results.

Movie Prep:

If you've seen any of the spoof movies from the ZAZ team (Airplane, Top Secret), then you'll likely enjoy this too. The humor is crude, and even childish, but you're still likely going to find something to laugh at here.

Best Format:

There's nothing tremendously visual about the film. You'll get the same enjoyment regardless of the device you choose to watch it on.

Best moment:

One of the my favorite scenes is when Frank goes to get information from a local informant. Follow this url to watch the clip. http://talkiegazette.com/the-naked-gun-from-the-files-of-police-squad-1988/

Oftentimes a casually gut-busting, hilarious film, the first of the Naked Gun series is a pile of goofy humour ranging from slapstick to satire in one smooth, mock-filled narrative.

The Naked Gun, in essence, provides us with hilarious entertainment for 85 minutes. That's about all of the purpose of this movie. If you expected solid character studies, emotional depth, or Oscar-caliber performances, than you're watching the wrong movie.

Leslie Nielsen's second successful project after the hilarious Airplane was just as daft, in what was this, the first part of a comical trilogy. Put on the case to investigate the shooting of OJ Simpson, Detective Drebin conjures up a number of spoofy ways to hunt down the terrorist figure behind it all. As he gets deeper involved in what turns out to be a huge case involving drugs, assassination attempts, and simple old murder, the giggles arrive thick and fast in a wonderfully scripted comedy. Never over complicating the joke, it's plain old dad wit right throughout, with a hint of sexually related crudeness. I particularly like the 'nice beaver' comment , made as the character stands underneath a ladder that a woman is climbing, moments before she passes him the actual product of a taxidermist, commenting 'Thanks, I just had it stuffed'. Cringe worthy as it may sound, it's rib tickling stuff with various references to other films as it progresses, James Bond and his gadgets in particular. It's amazing how many modern films have still not surpassed the hilarity of 30 years ago, but I guess that's a matter of individual taste really. I would much prefer to see more of this genre, albeit what would sadly have to be without the late Leslie Nielsen.

A classic comedy and one of the funniest ever. Zucker and Abrahams have had a line of disappointing films for me such as Top Secret and Hot Shots but The Naked Gun made up for it with hilarious scenes that are so dumb (yet witty) that they're funny.
The film follows idiotic cop and even more of an idiotic driver Lt. Frank Drebin, who is assigned to protect the Queen of England when she visits America. Drebin suspects rich hot shot Vincent Ludwig to have something sneaky up his sleeve and then meets his associate Jane, who Frank has an on and off relationship with throughout the film. As the film goes on, Frank must protect the Queen from an assassination attempt at an MLB game all while constantly throwing hilarious jokes and scenes at the viewers. The Naked Gun is a great comedy and is considered a classic comedy.
Leslie Neilsen is superb at what he does, he was a great actor and he's even better at producing laughs. Lt. Drebin is such a likable character, too, he's such an idiot but you root for him as the film goes on. I wasn't too big of a fan with Presley's character, she's not the best actress around, but she did what she could. The film is hilarious and one you should watch more than once to laugh at all of the jokes, there's just so many great scenes and lines. I heard there's also a possible reboot with Ed Helms, I'm not expecting much other than disappointment from that. You can't beat this classic.

David Zucker and Leslie Nielsen are at it again with another fantastic spoof movie. It makes sense that the people behind Airplane! could bring us more laughs. This film isn't as good as Airplane!, but it certainly isn't bad. It uses clever one liners and funny gags to bring the laughs. Not every single line and gag work, but with the abundance of them, the ones that work outweigh the ones that don't. Leslie Nielsen is perfect for this role. He's able to deliver those clever one liners with ease, as well as pull of the oblivious goofball character perfectly. Something I usually don't praise in movies is the runtime, but here the runtime was spot on. Spoof movies generally need to be about an hour and a half long, and this movie gets it just right. Like I said before, it's not as funny as Airplane!, but it certainly has its moments of clever humor and should definitely be seen.
One of the greatest comedies of all time

This one took me by surprise. For years I've put off watching it as I'm not a fan of spoof or silly movies. Must say this had me laughing out loud. Leslie Nielsen is absolutely brilliant in the lead role. Looking forward to watching the sequels now. 8/10

When I was 12 in 1988, this film was the most hilarious movie ever - it was insanely funny. Looking at it now, the movie's rather thin plot is merely an excuse for a sequence of hit or miss gags. If nothing else, the movie features one of the most unlikely casts ever; Leslie Nielsen (once a dramatic leading man), O.J. Simpson (no comment), George Kennedy ("Cool Hand Luke"). Priscilla Presley (Elvis' wife!), and Ricardo Montalban ("Fantasy Island") who steals every scene he's in!
4/5  Hilarious...watched it again with family over Thanksgiving.

Not exactly my sense of humor, but this still has some laughs.  So this is about accident prone cop Frank Drebin (Leslie Nielsen).  It is up to him to foil an assassination plot on the Queen Elizabeth II when she is visiting the States.  Now I don't typically go for parody movies; I like Airplane!, and I like Edgar Wright, but that's pretty much the extent of what I enjoy of the subgenre.  The thing about comedy though is that is arguably the most subjective genre out there, and while I know plenty of people that like the Naked Gun series, what works for them doesn't necessarily work for me.  The jokes featured are very upfront (a lot of them play their hand too early), and I personally prefer a subtler delivery of humor.  But hey, these are the jokes, and I would be lying if I said I didn't get a few laughs out of this.  What works best are the random non sequiturs that are left unexplained, because they really do take you by surprise.  Also, it's hard not to like the deadpan Nielson, as he does have a lot of natural charisma.  For me, slapstick and pratfalls work exponentially better in silent films, but hey, different strokes for different folks, and there are certainly worse spoof movies out there.
maybe the funniest spoof movie ever except for Young Frankenstein
